page.title: 08Churches-Knutton and Keele
page.content: Knutton has three churches.St.Mary's, the Anglican church was consecrated by the Bishop of Lichfield in 1874 and is situated close to Cherry Hill school.A Church of England school has been built on the outskirts of the village.The present Knutton Methodist Church was opened on 25th July l981.It replaced the former building which became unsafe due to mining subsidence.The first chapel had been built in 1876.It was a two-storied building and was difficult to maintain.Our Lady of Sorrows is the Catholic Church.It was built in 1952 and was opened on June 15th.It was the first Catholic church to be built in Knutton. Keele Church was completed in 1870 and it was financed by the Sneyd Family,the principal local land owners at that time.There were traces of an earlier building on the site.
